page.title: 01LAURIESTON
page.content: The area around Laurieston consists of pleasant grassy farmland,for pasture and rough grazing.Cows and sheep are the main livestock,with grass used for hay and silage.There are a few small lochs ideal for fishing.The area is well known by bird watchers who enjoy bird watching by the lochs and streams.Wildfowl are in abundance and are a source of delight.There is,quite nearby, Laurieston Forest,owned by the Forestry Commission.This is a delightful spot for walking and orienteering and ideal for picnics.The village itself is small,having approximately 50 houses.There is a village school with 26 children from 5 to 11 years of age.There is no longer a village church.The church at nearby Balmaghie is used for worship.There is no shop,but the nearby town of Castle Douglas is only some 6 miles away.
